title: Joe Biden heads to Middle East amid faltering US sway
description: The US president's visit to the turbulent region may highlight the limits of American power.

title: 'Flying my parrot is a reason to go out'
description: Chloe Brown has taught her harlequin macaw how to free fly in locations including the Peak District.

title: CEO Secrets: How one company attracts more men
description: Mary Ellen Iskenderian, president and CEO of non-profit organisation Women's World Banking, shares her business advice.

title: Former airline worker: 'It would be like going back to an ex'
description: Three people who used to work in aviation up until the Covid pandemic discuss whether they would return to the industry.

title: Ukraine's rock warrior Slava Vakarchuk: 'We need to be angry'
description: Slava Vakarchuk is the lead singer of Okean Elzy, Ukraine's most popular rock band.

title: Cost of living: The family who gave up a car to cycle every day
description: Lindsay, Simon and their two daughters say they've saved up to £400 a month by ditching their car.

title: Euro 2022: Germany win Group B and move into quarter-finals with 2-0 win over Spain
description: Eight-time European champions Germany defeat Spain to secure top spot in Group B and avoid a Euro 2022 quarter-final tie with England.

title: Euro 2022: Pernille Harder scores as Denmark beat Finland to keep hopes of progress alive
description: Pernille Harder's second-half goal ensures Denmark keep their hopes of progressing from Group B alive as they beat a determined Finland at Euro 2022.

title: Euro 2022: Denmark's Lene Christensen pulls off match-winning save against Finland
description: Watch Denmark's Lene Christensen pull off a remarkable save to help secure a 1-0 win against Finland at Euro 2022.

title: Emmys 2022: Succession leads US TV award nominations
description: The show leads the race for the US TV awards, with nominations for both Brian Cox and Jeremy Strong.

title: Telford child sex abuse went on for generations, inquiry finds
description: Agencies blamed children and not perpetrators for the abuse suffered in Telford, the report says.

title: James Webb: Nasa space telescope delivers spectacular pictures
description: A "stellar nursery" and a "cosmic dance" are among James Webb's first batch of colour images.

title: Ukraine war: Iran plans to supply Russia with drones, US warns
description: A top US official says Iran is preparing to send weapons-capable drones to Russia for use in Ukraine.

title: Speed limit to be lowered to 20mph in Wales
description: It is claimed Wales could be world's first nation to adopt a 20mph default limit in built-up areas.

title: Train drivers very close to going on strike, union warns
description: Aslef boss Mick Whelan says a walk-out could happen within weeks if pay talks with management fail.

title: Sir Mo Farah reveals he was trafficked to the UK as a child
description: The Olympic star says the name Mohamed Farah was given to him by a stranger who flew him to the UK.

title: Euro 2022: Why England fans are right to get excited - but players must stay grounded after 8-0 win
description: England's stunning performance against Norway rightly made fans excited but the players must remain focused as they prepare for the quarter-finals of the Euros.

title: Shinzo Abe: Japanese mourners pay last respects to ex-PM at funeral
description: Thousands showed up to pay their last respects to Japan's longest-serving prime minister.

title: Manchester United and Frenkie de Jong: Senior club figures in Barcelona to break impasse
description: Senior Manchester United figures Richard Arnold and John Murtough are in Barcelona trying to break the impasse over the club's pursuit of Dutch midfielder Frenkie De Jong.

title: Gary Speed: Wales manager's mother talks about his death
description: The mum of the former Wales football boss opens up more than a decade after he took his own life.

title: Champions League: Witnesses raise new questions about chaos of Paris final
description: A BBC probe into the issues at the Stade de France hears evidence that contradicts French authorities.

title: SAS killings: How a scandal was uncovered
description: Panorama brought a series of suspicious killings of civilians to light, after four years of detective work.

title: SAS reports reveal troubling pattern of suspicious deaths in Afghanistan
description: Internal emails seen by the BBC show top special forces officers were aware of concerns over killings.

title: The Papers: Sunak's tax pledge and Mo Farah revelations
description: Expected tax cut vows by Rishi Sunak and Mo Farah's revelation that he was smuggled to the UK feature on the front pages.

title: Roe v Wade: Abortion pills a new front in culture wars
description: Abortion pills - the most common way to end pregnancies in the US - are in activists' crosshairs.

title: Sri Lanka: Opposition leader ready to run for presidency
description: Sajith Premadasa tells the BBC he plans to run for the presidency, after urgent talks with allies.

title: Sex assault victims warn about home massage dangers
description: The BBC has spoken to women who say they were sexually assaulted during massage treatments.

title: Sally Phillips on daring to star in a sex comedy film
description: The actress on playing a woman who starts an all-male house cleaning business - with extras.

title: The Big Plastic Count: Survey shows 'recycling doesn't work'
description: Organisers estimate the UK throws out nearly 100 billion pieces of plastic each year.
